column5: It is with great displeasure to bring you this news. Peter Lee, the owner of Peter's Tackle in St Catharines has passed away. I do not have all the details yet but I know it was way too soon. Peter was a terrific person and business man and person and he leaves behind a beautiful family. I will miss him greatly.  Funeral Arrangements are being made at Butlers Funeral Home 905-646-6322. There may be a viewing tonight I'm really not sure.  Rest in Peace Peter Lee
Condolences to the family.  I didn't really know Peter, but he did sell me some custom spoons for Salmon fishing that put a # of fish into the net for me.  Any guy that can do that is ok by me  Tony
My condolences to the families I just stopped into Franks(Bronte Outdoors) and he told me the news it was very sudden and Frank seems to be in shock I hope he closes up and goes home  VERY SAD NEWS

LEE, Pil Woo: At the Greater Niagara General Hospital on Friday, april 20, 2007 at the age of 44 years. Husband of Hee-Jung . Father of Elizabeth. Mr. Lee is at the NIAGARA ST. CHAPEL of BUTLER FUNERAL HOME, 424 Niagara St. (south of Scott) where a Korean Service wil be held on Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Visitation will be held on Sunday from 2-4 p.m. Funeral Liturgy will take place at St. Mary's of the Assumption Church, 169 St. Paul Cres., St. Catharines on Monday, April 23, 2007 at 11:00 a.m. Interment at Pleasantview Memorial Gardens, Fonthill, ON. BUTLER (905) 646-6322.
I never had the pleasure of meeting the man, but 44 is certainly far too young.  Condolances to the family.
I, quite obviously because of where I live, have not met him, but I agree, 44 is way to young, as I am past that age. My condolences go out to his family also.
Sad news...Peter was the Tackle guy in St. Catharines for the last 20 years.
Seems as though we lose some of the good ones way too young while the not so good ones hang on for ever. Rest in peace Peter.
R.I.P peter. you'll be sadly missed by many.. cliff...
Wow..I had no idea Peter was not well. I haven't sen him since last fall. Very tragic. His wife and family have my utmost condolences.

We are in shock.  This is truly a very sad day.  Peter was always good to me and my wife.  He was a true gentleman and friend.  He was always very friendly and I enjoyed every visit to his store.  Our thoughts and prayers are with his family and friends.

as a 10 year old, I would be there each week using my allowance/paper route money to buy hooks & worms, been a loyal customer for many years  very nice genuine guy - allways donating to various events/causes - he had just set his shop up in a bigger spot almost a year ago  sincere condolences to Angela, Elizabeth & family  Pete will sure be missed & remembered by many
Best wishes to his friends and family.
That's very sad  Rest in Peace!

Made the drive to Petes from Buffalo years ago to buy my first centerpin. I was there a short while, but his shop was outstanding......couldnt have been a bigger help while i was there. Sorry to hear the news, prayers and thoughts out to all that were close.
